description: From Medieval Latin ēditor, from Late Latin ēditor, from ēditus, perfect passive participle of ēdō (“give out, put forth, publish”).

entries.meaning: A person who edits or makes changes to documents.
A person who edited a specific document.
examples: John Johnson wrote this term paper and the editor was Joan Johnson.

entries.meaning: A person at a newspaper, publisher or similar institution who edits stories and/or decides which ones to publish.
examples: John is the city editor at the Daily Times.

entries.meaning: A machine used for editing (cutting and splicing) movie film
(computing) A program for creating and making changes to files, especially text files.
examples: The TPU EVE editor is an excellent, extensible, programmable editor.

entries.meaning: (television, cinematography) Someone who manipulates video footage and assembles it into the correct order etc for broadcast; a picture editor.
